title: Teacher-Student Interaction Assessment Competency Development Program for Promoting Mathematical Thinking in Smart Classroom Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Bloomâ€™s Revised Taxonomy, mastery of instructional design principles, experience with VR simulation tools, basic statistical analysis skills, and comprehension of mathematical problem-solving strategies
context.additional_context: Emphasis on computational thinking in math simulations within BYOD environments, decision-making modeling using AHP weighted analysis tools, and application of reasoning/proof/problem-solving strategies to promote HOT (Higher Order Thinking).

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively and qualitatively assess mathematical interaction levels using five primary indicators and 18 sub-indicators during smart classroom observations.
Learners can apply HOT (Higher Order Thinking) strategies for analysis/evaluation/creation phases in VR simulation environments to mathematical problem-solving with 80% accuracy.
Learners can calculate weights of mathematical interaction items using the AHP (Analytic Hierarchy Process) with 0.8 reliability and verify statistical significance.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
